verses.text: \add It is a\add* good \add thing\add* to give thanks unto the \sc Lord\sc*, And to sing \add praises\add* unto thy name, O most High:
To shew forth thy lovingkindness in the morning, And thy faithfulness every night,
Upon an instrument of ten strings, and upon the psaltery; Upon the harp with a solemn sound.
For thou, \sc Lord\sc*, hast made me glad through thy work: I will triumph in the works of thy hands.
O \sc Lord\sc*, how great are thy works! \add And\add* thy thoughts are very deep.
A brutish man knoweth not; Neither doth a fool understand this.
When the wicked spring as the grass, And when all the workers of iniquity do flourish; \add It is\add* that they shall be destroyed for ever:
But thou, \sc Lord\sc*, \add art most\add* High for evermore.
For lo, thine enemies, O \sc Lord\sc*, For lo, thine enemies shall perish; All the workers of iniquity shall be scattered.
But my horn shalt thou exalt like \add the horn of\add* an unicorn: I shall be anointed with fresh oil.
Mine eye also shall see \add my desire\add* on mine enemies, \add And\add* mine ears shall hear \add my desire\add* of the wicked that rise up against me.
The righteous shall flourish like the palm tree: He shall grow like a cedar in Lebanon.
Those that be planted in the house of the \sc Lord\sc* Shall flourish in the courts of our God.
They shall still bring forth fruit in old age; They shall be fat and flourishing;
To shew that the \sc Lord\sc* \add is\add* upright: \add He is\add* my rock, and \add there is\add* no unrighteousness in him.
